TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ConstructionEnabledAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Enables COM+ object construction support. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ConstructionEnabledAttribute>, see the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ConstructionEnabledAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/docs/standard/attributes/index.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this attribute to associate an object constructor string with a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> class.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/CPP/employeeinformation.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[EnterpriseServices_Security#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/CS/employeeinformation.cs#4)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/VB/employeeinformation.vb#4)]

|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |`Default`|An empty string ("")| |`Enabled`|`true`|

Docs.param: to enable COM+ object construction support; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, setting to the specified value.
Gets or sets a default value for the constructor string.
Docs.value: The value to be used for the default constructor string. The default is an empty string ("").

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether COM+ object construction support is enabled.
Docs.value: if COM+ object construction support is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .
